name: Thabo
dialog: Howzit, my friend!
Joburg traffic is something else, hey?
You really need patience to survive the city.
postQuestDialog: Hey! You actually found all the taxi coins.
That helps more people than you think.

quest.description: Recover 3 coins dropped during the early-morning taxi rush near the harbour road.

name: Lerato
dialog: I miss the smell of rain in Limpopo.
Summer storms hit hard but fade quickly.
Nature really shows off here.

name: Sipho
dialog: Braai day is the best day of the week.
Everyone argues about boerewors brands.
But as long as the fire is hot, we’re good.

name: Nomsa
dialog: Cape Town winds are no joke.
One minute it's calm, the next your hat is gone.
Still, the ocean makes it worth it.

name: Kagiso
dialog: Soweto has so much history.
Every street tells a story.
You can feel it when you walk around.
postQuestDialog: Good. People forget how important they are.

quest.description: Follow Kagiso’s memories by finding 2 places that still carry the town’s old stories.

name: Zanele
dialog: Xitsonga music always lifts my mood.
The rhythm just gets into your feet.
You can’t stand still listening to it.

name: Musa
dialog: Durban’s beaches are the best.
Warm water, warm people.
Just watch out for the sunburn.

name: Anele
dialog: The Drakensberg mountains are breathtaking.
Hiking there clears your mind.
It makes you feel very small.

name: Vusi
dialog: Load shedding really tests our patience.
At least we’ve mastered cooking with gas.
You have to laugh sometimes.

name: Busisiwe
dialog: Xitsonga and isiZulu sound beautiful together.
Languages connect people.
South Africa has so many voices.

name: Sibusiso
dialog: Minibus taxis run this country.
Without them, everything stops.
You learn to move fast at the rank.
postQuestDialog: You found the missing route sign!
Now drivers won’t be arguing all day.

quest.description: Help Sibusiso by finding a missing taxi route sign.

name: Palesa
dialog: Spring flowers in the Free State are stunning.
The fields turn purple and yellow.
It’s like a painting.

name: Andile
dialog: Soccer brings everyone together.
When Bafana Bafana plays, the streets go quiet.
Until someone scores!

name: Kgotso
dialog: Peace and calm are important in life.
Sometimes you just sit and watch the sunset.
That’s enough.

name: Nandi
dialog: Traditional beadwork takes patience.
Every color has meaning.
It’s more than just decoration.

name: Themba
dialog: I learned to drive on gravel roads.
You really learn control that way.
City driving feels easy after that.

name: Ayanda
dialog: Xitsonga stories from elders are powerful.
They teach lessons without lectures.
You remember them forever.

name: Mandla
dialog: Strength isn’t just physical.
Surviving tough times builds character.
South Africans know that well.

name: Noluthando
dialog: Love and kindness go a long way.
Even a small greeting can change a day.
Ubuntu is real.

name: Hlokomela
dialog: Looking after each other matters.
Community makes life easier.
We are stronger together.
postQuestDialog: I heard you helped the neighbors.
That kind of kindness spreads quickly.

name: Thandi
dialog: Morning traffic feels different before sunrise.
The city sounds quieter then.
You notice things you normally miss.

name: Refilwe
dialog: The park used to be full of kids.
Lately it feels forgotten.
Small things can bring life back.

quest.description: Pick up 5 pieces of litter in the park.

name: Bongani
dialog: Street lights make people feel safer.
This one’s been broken for weeks.
Someone needs to check on it.
postQuestDialog: You got the light working again!
Now people won’t rush home in fear.

quest.description: Inspect and restore the broken street light.

name: Keabetswe
dialog: Kids love chasing pigeons here.
But they keep losing their balls.
Always rolling into the street.
postQuestDialog: They’re going to be so happy.

quest.description: Find 3 lost play balls near the street.

name: Samkelo
dialog: Vendors rely on foot traffic.
Signs help people find us.
Mine blew away last night.

name: Mpho
dialog: The community board keeps us informed.
Not many people check it anymore.
Notices get lost.
postQuestDialog: You pinned the notices back up?
